name: Surf and Turf for Two
author: Staci
summary: This is a simple way to make a special dinner any night of the week. You probably have most of the ingredients in your pantry already. Serve shrimp alongside steaks with your favorite sides.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
⅛ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
directions: Whisk 1 tablespoon olive oil, butter, onion, wine, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, parsley, seafood seasoning, garlic, and black pepper together in a bowl; add shrimp
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for flavors to blend, at least 15 minutes
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate
Coat steaks with 2 teaspoons olive oil; sprinkle with steak seasoning
Cook steaks until they are beginning to firm and have reached your desired doneness, 5 to 7 minutes per side
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C)
Transfer steaks to a platter and loosely tent with a piece of aluminum foil
Remove shrimp from marinade and grill until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is no longer transparent in the center, 2 to 3 minutes per side
